item.mbd2.mbd_gadgets.tooltip: §2Shift + right click to switch the gadget modes.§r
item.mbd2.mbd_gadgets.multiblock_builder: Right click on the controller to auto build the multiblock.
item.mbd2.mbd_gadgets.recipe_debugger.to: Open UI to set a test recipe.
Right click on the machine to check whether the recipe can be processed (with failure reason).
item.mbd2.mbd_gadgets.recipe_debugger.wa: §cWarning§r: machine's recipe type (%d) is not equal to the recipe's recipe type (%d).
item.mbd2.mbd_gadgets.recipe_debugger.mo: Machine won't modify the raw recipe.
recipe.condition.name: Recipe Condition
recipe.condition.block.tooltip: blocks [%s] count in the structure from %d to %d
project.reload.recipe: §cNOTE:§r You have to execute /reload or re-enter the world to actually reload the built-in recipes.
config.require_restart: §cYou need to restart the game to apply the changes.§r
config.recipe.condition.machine_level.le: The machine level of the machine.
config.recipe.condition.machine_custom_d: The machine custom data of the machine.
config.block_properties.render_types.too: The render type of the block.
config.block_properties.rotation_state.t: The rotation state of the block.
config.block_properties.has_collision.to: If the block has the collision box.
config.block_properties.can_occlude.tool: If the block can occlude other blocks.
config.block_properties.dynamic_shape.to: If the block has a dynamic shape.
If the block can be ignited by lava.
config.block_properties.is_air.tooltip: If the block can be regarded as an air block.
config.block_properties.is_suffocating.t: If the block can suffocate entities.
config.block_properties.emissive.tooltip: If the block is emissive rendering.
config.block_properties.friction.tooltip: Determines how much velocity is maintained while moving on top of this block
config.block_properties.speed_factor.too: Determines how much velocity is maintained while moving on top of this block
config.block_properties.jump_factor.tool: Determines how high the player will jump when on top of this block
config.block_properties.destroy_time.too: How long it takes to break the block.
config.block_properties.explosion_resist: How resistant the block is to explosions.
config.block_properties.use_ao.tooltip: Whether render the block with Ambient Occlusion.
config.block_properties.transparent.tool: enable it if your block is a glass-like block.
config.item_properties.max_stack_size.to: The maximum stack size of the item.
config.item_properties.use_block_light.t: Allows control of the lighting when rendering a model in a GUI.
True - the model will be lit from the side, like a block.
False - the model will be lit from the front, like an item.
config.item_properties.item_tooltips.too: The tooltips of the item which will be shown in the GUI by hovering.
config.item_properties.is_gui_3d.tooltip: Whether render the item in GUI as a 3D model.
config.item_properties.creative_tab.tool: The creative tab to display the item in.
Enable - set a separated renderer for item.
Disable - use the renderer of root state machine instead.
config.machine_state.renderer.tooltip.0: Enable - set a separated renderer for this machine state.
config.machine_state.renderer.tooltip.1: Disable - use the renderer of root state machine instead.
config.machine_state.shape.tooltip.0: shape is consist of cubes, make sure the shape radius is no more than 2 blocks (minecraft rule).
config.machine_state.shape.tooltip.1: Enable - set a separated shape for this machine state.
config.machine_state.shape.tooltip.2: Disable - use the shape of root state machine instead.
config.machine_state.shape.tooltip.3: §4Note:§r Setting a separated shape have to set the §cdynamic shape§r to true in the block properties as well.
config.machine_state.light.tooltip.0: Enable - set a separated emissive light for this machine state.
config.machine_state.light.tooltip.1: Disable - use the light of root state machine instead.
config.machine_state.rendering_box.toolt: It's used to define a visible box for BlockEntityRenderer in the world.
Enable - set a separated rendering box for this machine state.
Disable - use the rendering box of root state machine instead.
config.machine_settings.machine_level.to: The machine level. It can be used for recipe conditions.
config.machine_settings.has_ui.tooltip: Whether the machine has a GUI.
config.machine_settings.has_recipe_logic: If false, the machine will not process recipes.
Please set it false for better performance if the machine does not need to process recipes.
config.machine_settings.max_parallel.too: The value is he maximum number of parallel that can be processed. Do not set it too high.
Whether modify the duration of the recipe.
config.machine_settings.recipe_damping_v: if the recipe handling is waiting, damping value is the decreased ticks of the current progress.
config.definition.id.tooltip: The unique identifier of the definition.
Whether it can be regarded as a part of a multiblock.
If false, the machine will perform as a normal single block.
If true, the machine will support additional "part" features on a single block
config.part_settings.can_share.tooltip: Whether the part can be shared among multiple multiblocks.
config.part_settings.formed_tips.info: There is no §cformed§r state found, do you want to auto-gen the state.
config.part_settings.target_content.tool: The target content should be modified.
config.part_settings.proxy_capability.tr: All traits that name contain the filter name will be proxied.
e.g. if the filer name is §cempty§r, all traits that name contain will be proxied.
config.part_settings.proxy_controller_ca: If the part doesnt contain the required capability, the part will proxy the capabilities from controllers’ traits.
config.recipe.recipe_modifiers.tooltip: To modify the (self / controller) recipe on the fly. You can use it to make a upgrade / plugin part.
config.recipe.content_modifier.tooltip: The content modifier for recipe content. e.g. item count, fluid amount. etc
config.recipe.duration_modifier.tooltip: The duration modifier for recipe duration.
config.recipe.recipe_conditions.tooltip: Handling Recipe Modifiers if and only if conditions are satisfied.
config.recipe.target_content.tooltip: e.g. IN - input content, OUT - output content.
config.multiblock_settings.catalyst.tool: require a catalyst for multiblock forming
config.multiblock_settings.catalyst.cand: If enabled, use catalyst on these blocks can form the multiblock as well.
config.multiblock_settings.show_ui_when_: If true, right-click on the blocks of the structure can open ui.
config.definition.kinetic_machine_settin: The settings of the create kinetic machine, e.g. rotation, models.
config.kinetic_machine.is_generator.tool: Whether the kinetic machine is a generator.
config.kinetic_machine.torque.tooltip.0: Torque defines the relationship between rpm and stress.
config.kinetic_machine.front_rotation.to: Get the rotation axis facing based on the machine front facing
config.kinetic_machine.has_back_rotation: If true, the rotation will be passed to the back of the rotation axis side.
If false, only the rotation axis side can be rotated.
config.kinetic_machine.max_rpm.tooltip.0: If is a generator, the maximum RPM can provide.
config.kinetic_machine.max_rpm.tooltip.1: If not a generator, over rpm will be broke.
config.kinetic_machine.use_flywheel.tool: Whether the kinetic renderer uses the flywheel instance. (flywheel will have better performance)
config.definition.trait.name: Name
config.definition.trait.priority.tooltip: The priority of the capability, higher priority will be processed / presented first.
config.definition.trait.capability_io.to: Behavior of capability on all sides of the machine.
e.g. if you set the §4top§r as §cOUT§r for a item capability trait. The top side of the machine can only be extracted.
config.definition.trait.capability_io.in: Behavior when side is not specified.
config.definition.trait.recipe_handler.t: Whether this trait is considered an input or an output in recipe handling
config.definition.trait.gui_io.tooltip: Whether this trait io directions for GUI handling
config.definition.trait.distinct.tooltip: Enabled - This trait is availabe during recipe processing if and only if all ingredient of the same type are consumed or produced only in this trait.
Disabled - Recipe processing when any combination of non-distinct traits satisfies the recipe.
config.definition.trait.slot_names.toolt: The trait slot names, if the recipe's ingredient specifies a slot name, then the ingredient can only be processed at the trait that has that slot name.
config.definition.trait.ui.generate.tool: §egenerate a template for the trait UI.§r
config.definition.trait.item_slot.name: Item Slot
config.definition.trait.item_slot.ui.too: You can use §cItem Slot§r to customize slots. Item Slots you add yourself need to set their ids as §e[definition name]_[index of slot]§r. For example, if your definition's name is §emy_slot§r, if you want to bind the slot to the slot index of 1, its id should be set to §emy_slot_1§r.
config.definition.trait.item_slot.slot_l: The max stored amount of the slot.
config.definition.trait.item_slot.fancy_: Allow you render stored item in the world. (e.g. drawer, pedestal.)
config.definition.trait.item_slot.filter: The item filter of the slot.
config.definition.trait.item_slot.auto_i: auto suck items from the world.
auto drop items to the world.
The range of the auto IO. it will be rotated by the machine facing.
The interval between each auto IO action in tick.
how many items can be processed per action.
config.definition.trait.fluid_tank.name: Fluid Tank
config.definition.trait.fluid_tank.ui.to: You can use §cFluid Slot§r to customize fluid tanks. Fluid Slots you add yourself need to set their ids as §e[definition name]_[index of tank]§r. For example, if your definition's name is §emy_tank§r, if you want to bind the slot to the tank index of 1, its id should be set to §emy_tank_1§r.
config.definition.trait.fluid_tank.allow: Can different tanks be filled with the same fluid.
config.definition.trait.fluid_tank.fancy: Allow you render stored fluid in the world. (e.g. fluid drawer, tank).
(it can only show the fluid in the first tank)
config.definition.trait.fluid_tank.filte: The fluid filter of the tank.
config.definition.trait.forge_energy_sto: Allow you render stored energy in the world. (e.g. Energy Container).
config.definition.trait.entity_handler.a: If it's input, the detection area of the entity.
If it's output, the random spawn area of the entity.
config.definition.trait.botania_mana_sto: Allow you render stored mana in the world. (e.g. Mana Storage).
config.definition.trait.aura_handler.rad: The radius of the aura area.
config.definition.trait.embers_ember_cap: Allow you render stored energy in the world. (e.g. Energy Container).
config.definition.trait.gtm_energy_conta: Whether the machine will explode when the voltage is overed.
The input voltage of the energy container.
If its capability io is OUT or BOTH, Max input eu (voltage * amp) per tick.
The output voltage of the energy container.
If its capability io is IN or BOTH, Max output (voltage * amp) per tick.
Allow you render stored energy in the world. (e.g. Energy Container).
config.definition.trait.mek_heat_contain: Returns the inverse conduction coefficient of a given capacitor. This value defines how much heat is allowed to be dissipated. The larger the number the less heat can dissipate. The trade-off is that it also allows for lower amounts of heat to be inserted.
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.f: The fancy renderer only work with specific machine states
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.p: The position offset of the fancy renderer.
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.r: The rotation of the fancy renderer.
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.s: The scale of the fancy renderer.
The spin speed of the renderer.
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.r: Whether render the stacked model if the number of stacks is greater than 1.
config.definition.trait.fancy_renderer.p: The height of the fancy renderer in percent of the stored content.
The trait can be added only once in a machine.
editor.machine.recipe_type.content.per_t: The amount of the content produced or consumed per tick.
editor.machine.recipe_type.content.chanc: The chance of the content produced or consumed.
editor.machine.recipe_type.content.tier_: The chance of the content produced or consumed per tier (machine level).
The real chance = chance + machine_level * chance_boost.
editor.machine.recipe_type.content.slot_: The binding slot name of the trait in recipe handling.
editor.machine.recipe_type.content.ui_na: The binding ui name of the content in XEI UI.
editor.machine_scene.draw_shape_frame_li: draw frame lines of the shape
editor.machine_scene.draw_rendering_box_: draw frame lines of the render bounding box
recipe_type.registry_name.tooltip: Registry name has to be unique.
recipe_type.require_fuel.tooltip: Whether the recipe type requires fuel to work. if true, you should add fuel recipes as well.
recipe_type.is_xei_visible.tooltip: Whether show the recipe type in the recipe viewer.
recipe_type.icon.tooltip: The icon of the recipe type, which will be displayed in the recipe viewer UI.
recipe_type.proxy_recipes.tooltip: The additional other recipe types will be handled as well. e.g. you can proxy smelting recipes here.
recipe.priority.tooltip: recipe priority. If there are several recipes meet requires, the lowest one will be processed first.
The tooltips of the predicate. which will be shown in the multiblock preview.
The minimum count of this block.
The maximum count of this  block.
config.block_pattern.predicate.minLayerC: The minimum count of this block in each layer.
config.block_pattern.predicate.maxLayerC: The maximum count of this block in each layer.
config.block_pattern.predicate.previewCo: The count of this block in the multiblock preview.
config.block_pattern.predicate.disableRe: Whether disable the block rendering when the multiblock formed.
config.block_pattern.predicate.controlle: if enabled, will match the front face of the controller.
The slot name for recipe handling.
config.predicate.tags.tooltip: match any one of block tags.

recipe.capability.mek_infuse.name: Mek Infuse Capability

editor.machine.multiblock.area_panel.sce: The visible radius of the scene for pattern area selection.
editor.machine.multiblock.area_panel.are: You can select area by Shift+Click.
editor.machine.multiblock.area_panel.con: The offset position of the controller in the area.
The face of the controller in the pattern.
editor.machine.multiblock.area_panel.gen: Successful! Please check the Multiblock Pattern Tab.
Successful! Please check the Shape Info Tab.
Generate the pattern / shape info based on the area.
editor.machine.multiblock.multiblock_pat: the layer with controller couldn't be repeated
geckolib_renderer.use_translucent.tips: use the translucent renderType to support transparent textures
geckolib_renderer.use_entity_gui_lightin: setup entity lighting in GUI rendering, in general, enable this option for better 3d shade.
geckolib_renderer.animation_stage.animat: The name of the animation refers to the animation file
geckolib_renderer.animation.animation_na: The name of the animation that can be triggered, it should be §cstandalone§r in one renderer.
content_modifier.multiplier.tips: The multiplier of the recipe content number.
content_modifier.addition.tips: The addition of the recipe content number.
MachineEvent.MachineAfterRecipeWorkingEv: The event will be triggered after a recipe process finish.
MachineEvent.MachineBeforeRecipeWorkingE: The event will be triggered before a recipe process start. Cancel the event will stop the recipe process.
MachineEvent.MachineDropsEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine is broken and drop stack.
MachineEvent.MachineNeighborChangedEvent: The event will be triggered when the neighbor block changed.
MachineEvent.MachineOnRecipeWaitingEvent: The event will be triggered when the recipe process is waiting every tich.
MachineEvent.MachineOnRecipeWorkingEvent: The event will be triggered when the recipe process is working every tich. Cancel the event will stop the recipe process.
MachineEvent.MachineOpenUIEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine UI is opened. Cancel the event will stop the UI opening.
MachineEvent.MachinePlacedEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine is placed.
MachineEvent.MachineRecipeStatusChangedE: The event will be triggered when the recipe status changed.
MachineEvent.MachineRemovedEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine is removed.
MachineEvent.MachineRightClickEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine is right-clicked.
MachineEvent.MachineStateChangedEvent.ti: The event will be triggered when the machine state changed. Cancel the event will block this change.
MachineEvent.Multiblock.MachineStructure: The event will be triggered when the multiblock structure is formed.
The event will be triggered when the multiblock structure is invalid.
MachineEvent.MachineOnLoadEvent.tips: The event will be triggered when the machine is loaded.
MachineEvent.MachineRecipeModifyEvent.Be: The event will be triggered before the recipe is modified by the recipe modifiers. Cancel the event will stop the modification.
MachineEvent.MachineRecipeModifyEvent.Af: The event will be triggered after the recipe is modified by the recipe modifiers.
MachineEvent.MachineCustomDataUpdateEven: The event will be triggered when the custom is updated from the server side.
MachineEvent.MachineTickEvent.tips: The event will be triggered every server tick.
MachineEvent.MachineClientTickEvent.tips: The event will be triggered every client tick.
MachineEvent.Multiblock.MachineUseCataly: The event will be triggered while using catalyst to form the stucture. Cancel the event will stop the forming.
graph_processor.node.mbd2.recipe_logic.s: The status of the recipe logic will be one of the following: §cIDLE§r, §cWORKING§r, §cWAITING§r, §cSUSPENDING§r.
graph_processor.node.mbd2.machine.photon: fx with the same identifier will be replaced.
whether to remove all particles directly when the bound object invalid or natural death.
if false, emitter will notify and wait all particle death when the fx was removed.
if true, emitter will remove and particles from rendering and ticking immediately when the fx was removed.
